CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 16, 1962, pg. 13 reads: "Bride Contest Finale - Participants and winners of the Fashion Review and June Bride Contest at John Wesley AME Zion Church, last Sunday evening, netted a total of $940.60. Miss Sherrian Mitchell is standing in for the bride, Miss Carolyn Terry, who qualified for bridal honors as representative of the group which reported $360.  Mrs. Lena B. Davis, general chairman, was captain of the winning group.  Mrs. Bernice Dobbs, representing the second-place group, chaired by Mrs. Vera Davis, was maid of honor.  Robert Golden was stand-in for the groom.  Hosea Young was best man.  Others in wedding party were Rhoda Estes, Debbie Taylor, Lindsay King and Lee B. Davis, who gave the bride away.  Captains and group leaders in the photo are Mmes. G. Briscoe, E. Teed, E. Patton, M. Glover, G. Wilson, M. Jackson, O. Pugh, M. Robinson and L. Jones.  Mrs. V. Winston was commentator.  Awards were presented by Bishop S.G. Spottswood (left background) and the Rev. H.W. McCreary III (right background), host pastor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Three women modeling knee length dresses, in John Wesley AME Zion Church for June Bride Contest and Fashion Review
CatSubject_tab: Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Churches--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.John Wesley African Methodist Episcopal Zion Church (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Contests--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.
